title: Account Manager
description:
About the job
Please submit your application in English.

This is a fixed term contract until 31st December 2025. Internally the role will be titled Campaign Manager.

This role is part of our eBay Inhouse team, where you will be employed by DEPT and embedded into eBay's global Lifecycle Marketing Team.

Job Purpose

We are looking for a Campaign Manager to create and execute customer-facing (CRM) campaigns to support eBay’s strategic, focus categories globally. You will drive these launches across all of eBay’s flagship owned channels (email, push notifications, homepage, in-app messaging, etc.) and eBay’s Global Markets.

This role will require adopting a customer-centric approach while working cross-functionally to develop, implement, and track the performance of marketing campaigns. The Campaign Manager will support work towards eBay Marketing KPIs and Business Strategies.

Key Responsibilities

Build & launch personalised customer experiences globally for category-specific products and features on eBay by creating and executing CRM campaigns, including:
Development of high-quality creative assets (briefs, feedback rounds), including working cross-functionally with Creative teams (internal/agencies), Legal, Privacy & Customer Service teams
Supporting audience segmentation and targeting efforts in partnership with the Team Lead, as well as Analytics, Database Marketing (DBM), and Product Marketing teams
Ensuring seamless execution & launch of customer-facing campaigns as owner of operational execution, including working cross-functionally with Campaign Planning & Operations Teams on building, experimentation and deployment of marketing campaigns
Ownership of campaign reporting, including collecting and providing insights to inform scaling decisions for tests
Ownership of project timeline, including tracking campaign development & keeping relevant stakeholders informed
Adopt an innovate-and-iterate mindset to support data-driven hypotheses in creation and iteration of campaigns, including supporting with the designing of A/B tests and ongoing optimization of campaigns based on learnings
Collaborate cross-functionally and across locations with globally-dispersed team members and external partners to deliver campaigns and share-out results

What We Are Looking For

3+ years of experience in digital marketing, preferably within CRM and owned channels (emails, onsite, push notifications, in-app messaging, etc)
University degree in a relevant area is a plus
Past experience or a working understanding of e-commerce, marketplaces, and online retail marketing is required.
Demonstrated passion or past experience within one/multiple eBay categories such as Fashion, Collectibles, Trading Cards or Motors is a significant plus
Customer-centric and hands-on individual, with demonstrated ability to manage performance against established KPIs
Shown success in a fast-paced, matrixed work environment, as well as the ability to thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving, and highly competitive industry
Project management experience with strong sense of accountability; notable organisational skills, attention to detail, and ability to plan and prioritise
Ability to build relationships and collaborate across all levels, functions and locations
Fluency in both German and English is required


WE OFFER

A flexible, hybrid working policy
A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards.
Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries. And we celebrate all of our successes together!
The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training, development and certifications.
Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE? 

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION 

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

title: Demand Generation Manager
description:
About the job
We’re looking for a strategic, hands-on Demand Generation Manager to lead and optimise our full-funnel demand marketing engine. This role will be responsible for driving lead generation, nurturing prospects, and ensuring the health and scalability of our marketing CRM ecosystem. You’ll play a pivotal role in helping us reach our revenue goals. continuously improving marketing performance across key growth markets to feed the sales funnel.
This is a cross-functional role that works closely with Product Marketing, Sales, and Regional Teams to convert interest into measurable pipeline growth.


Your Mission

Lead Generation, Nurture & Growth Marketing

Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns to drive qualified traffic and convert leads across the funnel
Align campaign strategies with buyer personas to ensure relevance and resonance
Partner with content and product teams to deliver targeted materials, including webinars, case studies, guides, and vertical-focused content
Test, iterate, and scale nurture flows based on engagement and performance insights

CRM & Marketing Automation (Owner of Insightly Marketing)

Lead the architecture, maintenance, and evolution of Adsquare’s marketing CRM system
Develop segmentation strategies and workflows for ongoing lead nurture and scoring
Ensure seamless integration with sales CRM for lead qualification and handoff
Monitor and maintain data quality, list hygiene, GDPR compliance, and opt-in/opt-out processes
Create reporting dashboards for campaign performance, lead progression, and SQL generation

Database Management & Growth

Own the strategy and execution for growing and enriching the marketing database through inbound and outbound efforts
Ensure contact enrichment, deduplication, and proper tagging across all regional and campaign data
Collaborate with RevOps to align scoring models, contact tiering, and ICP definitions

Field & Regional Marketing

Partner with the Head of Marketing to design and execute field marketing initiatives (e.g., events, webinars, partner activations) that align with regional revenue goals in DACH, UK, US, and other high-growth markets
Support localisation of campaign materials and messaging for regional effectiveness
Track and report on regional campaign success, including event ROI and SQL attribution


Your Profile

5+ years of B2B demand generation and/or growth marketing experience in adtech, SaaS, or martech environments
Demonstrated success in owning marketing automation and CRM platforms – ideally Insightly
Strong understanding of lead scoring, segmentation, lifecycle marketing, and GDPR-compliant data practices
Experience managing database growth, hygiene, and reporting infrastructure
Proficiency in analysing campaign performance and using insights to drive optimisation
Excellent communicator and collaborator with project management strengths


Your Opportunities

A key role in scaling a global marketing operation at the forefront of location intelligence and programmatic innovation
The opportunity to shape how Adsquare captures, nurtures, and activates leads across the marketing funnel - building from the bottom up
Access to modern marketing tools, a strong product offering, and a collaborative international team


Why us?

On top of a competitive package…

We are open to flexible work models: we work on a hybrid mode and remotely
To encourage education and professional growth, we offer an individual yearly budget of 1,200€
You are entitled to 30 vacation days per year
We offer BVG company ticket, JobRad bike leasing, Urban Sports Club membership, company pension scheme
We care about your mental health and provide you with coaching and counseling sessions through the collaboration with the Fürstenberg Institut
Regular team events and company events organised by our People team (Trust us, they know how to throw a party!)
We equip you with the latest hardware and provide you with all the tools you need to thrive

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - Scanner Pro
description:
About the job
Readdle is a pioneering force in the personal productivity space on Apple devices, having shaped the landscape since 2007. Our mission is to empower individuals and teams with innovative technology, enhancing their efficiency and creativity. We are dedicated to crafting exceptional mobile and desktop experiences for those who aspire to achieve more.

As the Senior Product Marketing Manager for Scanner Pro, you will be at the forefront of driving growth, adoption, and user engagement. You will help align our product with the real productivity challenges of our customers and lead innovative campaigns that shape the experience of millions of users globally.

What will you do in this role:

Refine the product's value proposition and positioning: Own the messaging, positioning, and value proposition for Scanner Pro, ensuring it's shaped by user insights, market trends, and business objectives. Collaborate closely with Product to recommend enhancements and drive strategy.
Drive growth: Lead the development of data-driven strategies to optimize onboarding, retention, and conversion. Collaborate with Product and Marketing teams to unlock growth opportunities through experimentation and user behavior insights.
Campaign strategy & execution: Design and execute multi-channel marketing strategies across paid, earned, and owned media, with the goal of driving awareness, new user acquisition, and subscribers.
Testing & hypotheses: Propose, implement, and analyze A/B tests and experiments to improve campaign performance, traffic, and conversion rates across key touchpoints.
Run pricing and paywall tests: Create a roadmap of tests for improving the performance of both pricing and paywalls in all segments, platforms, and regions. Work closely with the Product, Lifecycle, and Customer Insights teams to use best practice techniques to ensure we convert, activate, retain, and reactivate users at the key moment of purchase to grow user lifetimes and lifetime values.
Customer insight & competitive analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of target audiences and market trends to ensure the product evolves to meet user needs and maintain a competitive edge.
Plan and execute new product launches: Work closely with a range of cross-functional teams to manage onboarding and conversion for all new product launch projects.
Budget management: Manage campaign budgets effectively, focusing on maximizing returns across channels.
Data-driven decision-making: Collaborate with the Analytics team to analyze campaign data, track KPIs, and refine acquisition strategies based on insights.

About you: 

You have 6+ years of experience in mobile app marketing, with a proven track record of driving growth and user engagement for mobile products, preferably in the consumer tech or productivity space.
You are an innovative marketer with hands-on experience launching new digital products and features that delight users and solve real pain points. You're comfortable working in a fast-paced, ambitious environment.
You're a master storyteller. You can craft compelling narratives that resonate with both internal stakeholders and external users, shaping messaging that drives product success across different markets.
You hold high standards for design and execution. You understand the nuances between good and great and are committed to delivering exceptional quality in everything you do.
You're commercially oriented. You can dig into campaign data, identify performance bottlenecks, and recommend solutions that drive business outcomes.
You take a data-driven approach. You leverage analytics and customer insights to form hypotheses and optimize campaigns, balancing short-term wins with long-term strategy.
You have a customer-first mindset. You empathize deeply with users and work to create experiences that add significant value to their lives, leading to long-term retention and advocacy.
You are a collaborative leader. You have experience leading virtual teams across multiple regions and time zones, always maintaining alignment and morale. You inspire others to push the envelope and achieve great results.

Will be a plus:

Subscription revenue model expertise
MBA from a top tier university

What you will get at Readdle:

Customer-centric culture. We put our customers first. It means that every employee can benefit from interacting with our customers directly. It enables us to create and deliver the best solutions for millions of our users.
Professional growth. We are professionals at everything we do. It means we own our decisions, our work, and our results. We provide quality feedback to others and welcome feedback as an opportunity to learn and improve.
A team of amazing people. The greatest power we have is the team. It means we care about each other, ensure transparency, and invest in everyone's success.
Impact on our products. We aim to create valuable products. It means that we improve ourselves constantly by overcoming constraints, simplifying our processes, and improving our capacity.
Innovative culture. We try to be innovative and creative in everything we do. It means that we expect, appreciate and value new ideas.

title: Business Analyst
description:
About the job
Located in the vibrant heart of Berlin, Pandata provides advanced data solutions to empower companies with data, AI and technological innovation.

Our corporate clients trust us with strategy, solution design and implementation. We follow a holistic approach, covering the entire data stream from sourcing to processing and insight generation, using cutting-edge tools as well as custom solutions. We are a fast growing high performance business, built on a solid and stable foundation. We are ahead of the curve in a rapidly expanding market, which makes this an exciting time to join us. We are looking for people who want to tackle new challenges, take ownership of their work and seize this opportunity to make a personal impact.

As a highly purpose-driven organization, we exempt 10% of our week from work and dedicate it to personal, non-work-related activities, aiming to fulfill our promise of personal development beyond the traditional scope of the classical business objective.

As a Business Analyst you will develop and provide valuable insights about our client’s business across various businesses. You will ensure your project team builds a solid data infrastructure for our clients that fits their needs and business requirements.

Tasks

Communicate with our clients to understand their situation and needs
Create reports and dashboards using state-of-the-art data software and technologies
Work with data engineers and architects to ensure a solid data infrastructure
Perform in-depth analysis on business performance data
Dive deep into the data and ensure every reported number is meaningful to the client

Your Profile

Solid experience in working with data
Strong interest in communicating with stakeholders & clients
Independent working mentality, proactive attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset
Analytical skills and an affinity for digital business
Solid communication skills in German andEnglish
Experience with BI software or tools is a must

Why Pandata?

Build a great company and grow with us
Take responsibility and have an impact from day one
Develop yourself personally and professionally in a highly purpose-driven work environment
Acquire a highly demanded skill-set and technical prowess by working on projects with various different data set-ups and tech stacks
Work with a highly motivated and smart team, in a professional but human-centered environment
Profit from intense direct mentorship in your first months
Enjoy breakfast, lunch, snacks, hot and cold drinks, Friday beers and a lot more (visit our office chef Josh on instagram)
Join our frequent team events and get-togethers
Profit from our strong company benefit program (Public transport or bike subscription, language classes, Urban Sports Club subsidization, JobRad, purpose time)

At Pandata we value smartness and motivation over job posting requirements.

All applicants will be considered for all open roles.

title: Business Analyst
description:
About the job
Description

Founded in 2020, Kaiko Systems is a tech company driving digital innovation in the global maritime industry. Our mission is to make shipping safer, smarter, and more collaborative by transforming manual processes into actionable intelligence.

With our products, ship crews can collect reliable vessel data on the job, while our AI-powered analysis generates actionable insights for technical teams onshore. These insights help predict incidents, reduce downtime, and enhance safety and efficiency, empowering shipping companies to operate at their best.

At Kaiko Systems, we’re not just building technology — we’re delivering solutions that make a real difference in people’s work lives and their professional environment. Join us as we navigate the future of maritime together.

Your mission

As a Business Analyst, you’ll turn business questions into actionable insights. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze product usage, customer behavior, sales funnels, and operational metrics. Your work will directly inform strategy, product direction, and revenue growth.

What You'll Do

Data Analysis & Insights

Conduct data-driven analysis to identify growth opportunities, market shifts, and competitive trends that inform company-wide strategic decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to structure and evaluate key strategic initiatives, supporting decision-making with clear insights and scenario modeling.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources (CRM, product analytics, customer feedback, ops tools)
Translate data into business insights that inform product, sales, and customer strategies

Stakeholder Collaboration

Work with Sales to optimize pipeline reporting, conversion insights, and forecasting
Support Customer Success with churn analysis, health scoring, and renewal signals
Collaborate with Product to track feature usage, adoption, and user behavior
Partner with Operations to improve internal processes and reporting

Reporting & Tooling

Build dashboards and automated reports to increase visibility into key metrics
Help improve our analytics stack and ensure clean, reliable data sources
Create ad hoc analyses for strategic initiatives (e.g., new market sizing, cohort analysis)

Your Skillset To Navigate Success

3+ years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or strategy in high growth startups, investment banking, or consulting environments
Background in maritime, logistics, or industrial tech sectors is preferred
Knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
Strong understanding of SaaS metrics and business models
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and communication skills
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment
Experience with HubSpot, Mixpanel, or similar tools
Familiarity with Python or other scripting languages (for advanced analysis) is a plus

Worried you don’t check every box? If this role excites you, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be exactly what we’re looking for — either for this role or another one!

Why us?

Join a highly ambitious and diverse team with a collaborative working environment at a very exciting time in the company’s development, as we scale on the back of significant product market fit
Be at the forefront of digitalization in a critical global industry
Great office in the heart of Berlin as well as flexible / remote options
Flexible and hybrid work environment that values work-life balance
Generous vacation policy on top of bank holidays 

At Kaiko Systems, we believe that innovation thrives when diverse perspectives come together. As a forward-thinking maritime tech startup, we are committed to building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels empowered to contribute their unique talents and experiences. We value every individual’s cultural background, gender identity, age, ability, or any other characteristic that makes you who you are. By embracing these differences, we create an environment where collaboration flourishes and ideas grow. If you share our passion for revolutionizing the maritime sector through technology, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s chart new waters together.

About Us

We’re a growing company, expanding both our business and our team. To ensure everyone feels safe, can perform at their best, and to keep the company successful in uncharted waters, we’ve aligned on a set of values that guide us:

Put genuine human interactions first
Foster mutual respect and teamwork
Embrace innovation and challenge the norm
Commit to delivering quality from the outset
Take initiative and act with purpose
Prioritize clear and effective communication
Adapt and evolve
Equip our team with the best resources

These values shape how we work together and will be a part of our conversations during the recruiting process. By living these principles, we create an environment where both our people and our business can thrive, navigating challenges with confidence and purpose.
html:
About the job

Description

Founded in 2020, Kaiko Systems is a tech company driving digital innovation in the global maritime industry. Our mission is to make shipping safer, smarter, and more collaborative by transforming manual processes into actionable intelligence.

With our products, ship crews can collect reliable vessel data on the job, while our AI-powered analysis generates actionable insights for technical teams onshore. These insights help predict incidents, reduce downtime, and enhance safety and efficiency, empowering shipping companies to operate at their best.

At Kaiko Systems, we’re not just building technology — we’re delivering solutions that make a real difference in people’s work lives and their professional environment. Join us as we navigate the future of maritime together.

Your mission

As a Business Analyst, you’ll turn business questions into actionable insights. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze product usage, customer behavior, sales funnels, and operational metrics. Your work will directly inform strategy, product direction, and revenue growth.

What You'll Do

Data Analysis & Insights

  • Conduct data-driven analysis to identify growth opportunities, market shifts, and competitive trends that inform company-wide strategic decisions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to structure and evaluate key strategic initiatives, supporting decision-making with clear insights and scenario modeling.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources (CRM, product analytics, customer feedback, ops tools)
  • Translate data into business insights that inform product, sales, and customer strategies

Stakeholder Collaboration
  • Work with Sales to optimize pipeline reporting, conversion insights, and forecasting
  • Support Customer Success with churn analysis, health scoring, and renewal signals
  • Collaborate with Product to track feature usage, adoption, and user behavior
  • Partner with Operations to improve internal processes and reporting

Reporting & Tooling
  • Build dashboards and automated reports to increase visibility into key metrics
  • Help improve our analytics stack and ensure clean, reliable data sources
  • Create ad hoc analyses for strategic initiatives (e.g., new market sizing, cohort analysis)

Your Skillset To Navigate Success
  • 3+ years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or strategy in high growth startups, investment banking, or consulting environments
  • Background in maritime, logistics, or industrial tech sectors is preferred
  • Knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
  • Strong understanding of SaaS metrics and business models
  • Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and communication skills
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment
  • Experience with HubSpot, Mixpanel, or similar tools
  • Familiarity with Python or other scripting languages (for advanced analysis) is a plus

Worried you don’t check every box? If this role excites you, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be exactly what we’re looking for — either for this role or another one!

Why us?
  • Join a highly ambitious and diverse team with a collaborative working environment at a very exciting time in the company’s development, as we scale on the back of significant product market fit
  • Be at the forefront of digitalization in a critical global industry
  • Great office in the heart of Berlin as well as flexible / remote options
  • Flexible and hybrid work environment that values work-life balance
  • Generous vacation policy on top of bank holidays

title: Professional Services Consultant
description:
About the job
As a core member of our Service Delivery Team, you’ll own the end-to-end delivery of custom automation solutions that transform our enterprise clients’ workflows into efficient, user-friendly experiences. With the autonomy to own and shape projects from conception to implementation, you will combine analytical rigour with creative problem-solving skills to make Matterway a go-to tool for our clients’ operational success. You’ll act as both a trusted advisor to customers and a strategic contributor to Matterway’s growth.

Responsibilities
Lead end-to-end agile delivery of custom automation solutions from kick-off to post-launch support
Collaborate with key users to map processes, understand pain points and identify inefficiencies in their workflows
Design user-centric technical solutions that balance innovation, usability, and measurable impact on the productivity, efficiency, and work quality of its users
Act as product owner for deliverables, overseeing the development, testing, and deployment of the solution while ensuring alignment with client expectations
Standardise design practices and contribute to product enhancements by sharing client insights with internal teams
Own the success of your solution by conducting impact assessments and using analytics to monitor adoption and measure value delivered
Build long-term partnerships with clients across multiple projects, acting as a trusted advisor and Matterway ambassador
Pave the way for business expansion by delivering exceptional results that drive customer happiness and referrals
What we are looking for
3-5 years of experience in consulting, business analysis, or process optimisation
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a talent for building client relationships
Proven ability to manage complex projects, prioritise dynamically, and solve problems creatively
Technical proficiency in process mapping, solution design, and translating technical details into client-friendly communication
Familiarity with agile methodologies and product ownership
Experience or interest in UI/UX design to create user-friendly solutions
Passion for innovation, customer success, and driving measurable business impact
Adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Why join us?
🌍 Transform Industries: Shape the future of automation and change how global enterprises operate
🚀 Own Your Impact: Your decisions directly influence product evolution and customer outcomes
💡 Innovate Fearlessly: A collaborative, agile culture that rewards creativity and growth
📈 Grow with Us: Opportunities for professional development in a scaling company

title: Technical Product Owner - Data Platform (f|m|x)
description:
About the job
Job Description

At idealo, data guides every decision. To support this, we offer a compliant, scalable, and cost-efficient data platform within the AWS ecosystem – enabling insights and establishing company-wide standards.

As Technical Product Owner (m|f|x) for the Infrastructure & Ingestion team, you will lead the development and optimization of the data infrastructure, in particular ensuring the reliability and customer orientation of future platform products.

The position is advertised as full-time or part-time.

About Your New Role

Strategic Planning and Roadmap Development

Setting the product directions as well as priorities for the roadmap with a focus on improving data quality.
Developing a strategic vision for products that are aligned with our business goals.
As part of the leadership team, you work hand in hand with the Staff Engineer and the Operations Lead to ensure high-performance delivery.

Product Development and Execution

Leading the implementation of functions to improve and extend self-service ingestion tooling, and a governed data platform.
Translating business requirements into technical specifications, ensuring that the solutions are reliable, scalable and user-friendly.

Cross-functional collaboration

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and align development work.
Collaborate with teams to integrate advanced technologies for data governance and quality assurance.

Data Governance and Quality Assurance

Implementing and adhering to data governance practices for the consistency and integrity of data for analytical use cases.
Monitoring data quality and compliance with regulations, taking corrective action where necessary to maintain high standards.

Performance Monitoring and Optimization

Monitoring of key performance indicators relating to the quality of data, operational efficiency and the effectiveness of the platform.
Identification of optimization opportunities to improve platform functions and benefits.

Job Requirements

Skills & Requirements

Must have:

You have professional experience as a (Technical) Product Owner or in a similar role, preferably in an e-commerce or data analytics environment.
Educational background in computer science, engineering or a related field.
Experience working with cloud-based technologies (e.g. AWS, Azure).
Practical experience with agile methods and project management tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in English to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Experience in application of driver trees and models to measure platform performance.

Nice to have:

Experience in big data platforms (e.g. Hadoop, Spark).
Experience in Data Warehouse (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake, dbt).
Interest in data architecture, platform tooling, and data governance practice.

At idealo you can expect

You need vacation? We offer you 30 days of vacation. Not enough? You can "buy" an additional 15 days every year by converting your salary and it's seen as a positive thing.
You want to further your education? We take your personal development goals seriously and, in addition to our idealo Learning Hub, eLearning offerings (e.g., Udemy), coaching & mediation, we also offer you the opportunity to benefit individually from additional learning and development budget.
And what about the office? Our office in the heart of Berlin offers free organic breakfast, excellent free lunch (vegan and vegetarian), as well as free coffee, lemonades and after-work beer, in addition to the "standard foosball". It also has a fabulous rooftop terrace with view of the whole of berlin where you can network with colleagues from our group of companies.
In need of additional support in any areas of your life? We offer free counseling and support in all areas of life (professional, private, family, health, etc.) in cooperation with the pme-Familienservice.
You want full flexibility on your way to work and beyond? No problem with a job bike or Deutschlandticket - and it's environmentally friendly, too!
Want to keep yourself fit? We offer many different fitness and sports options, such as an Urban Sports or Gympass membership, to suit your personal needs.
And what else is there? Of course, success must be celebrated! In addition to team events, you can also expect big company events and other moments of organized connection with others in the company and your team throughout the year!

About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with ~2.5 million visits per day, ~50,000 shops, and more than ~500 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, and Spain).

We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or a degree of disability are irrelevant.

If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside ~1000 idealos from ~60 nations, apply with us today.

Information for applicants with severe disabilities: As an applicant with a severe disability, you can get advice from our Representative Body for Severely Disabled People (SBV) during the application process. Please inform us regarding this topic.

For the inclusion of people with disabilities, our office is accessible without steps. When you start with us, we will see what else is needed!

We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, and Spain).

We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside ~1000 idealos from ~60 nations, apply with us today.

Information for applicants with severe disabilities: As an applicant with a severe disability, you can get advice from our Representative Body for Severely Disabled People (SBV) during the application process. Please inform us regarding this topic.

For the inclusion of people with disabilities, our office is accessible without steps. When you start with us, we will see what else is needed!

title: Product owner
description:
About the job
Cultural heritage data lives in databases, paper archives, books, and collections across the globe. But new digital tools can help connect those silos, encourage collaboration, and enhance transparency. NavigatingArt is a nonprofit organization that protects and promotes cultural heritage by empowering teams with the tools to create and publish digital catalogues raisonnés and archives.

We are looking for a highly motivated Product Owner (m/f/x) to coordinate the development of the NavigatingArt platform and its integrations. You'll work closely with our design, engineering, and domain expert teams, as well as external partners, including the Wildenstein Plattner Institute in New York and the Museum Barberini in Potsdam.

By joining NavigatingArt, you’ll contribute to a meaningful and ambitious initiative that bridges technology and cultural heritage. Help us bring it to life!

Tasks

Work as part of a cross-functional team of designers, engineers, and domain experts to develop user-centered solutions and guide the product through all stages of development.

Engage with internal and external stakeholders to gather insights, define requirements, and translate them into actionable plans for product development.

Conduct research initiatives to evaluate existing data models, schemas, standards, and comparable search experiences in the field of cultural heritage data.

Develop and maintain a product roadmap, balancing user needs with technical feasibility and ensuring timely delivery.

Communicate progress updates to stakeholders and senior management and ensure the development strategy is aligned with the overarching goals of NavigatingArt and its collaboration partners.


Requirements

3–5 years of experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role for a digital product or technology-driven environment (SaaS environment preferred).

Hands-on experience applying user-centered design by turning user feedback, research findings, and usability testing results into clear, actionable product decisions, particularly in digital platforms or data-driven tools.

Strong ability to communicate and coordinate effectively across technical and non-technical teams, ensuring clarity and alignment with stakeholders.

Interdisciplinary knowledge in at least one of the areas of (digital) art history, digital humanities, data science, or similar data-driven fields, with the ability to apply this knowledge to the development of cultural heritage data solutions.

Experience working in agile environments, managing backlogs, planning roadmaps, and iterating based on feedback while leveraging project management tools like Jira.

(Preferred) Experience with basic software engineering methodologies such as version control systems, trunk-based development, feature branches, or Git Flow that allow for efficient product delivery.

You share our values (listed below) and work in accordance with them.

Fluency in English; proficiency in German is appreciated.


Benefits

Competitive salary and work in small, autonomous teams with a high degree of creative freedom

A collaborative and open company culture that values diversity and work-life balance among our talented and inspiring colleagues from all over the world

Discounted public transport ticket (Deutschland Ticket) or Urban Sports Club membership

The chance to work on cutting-edge technology and opportunities for professional development and career growth

A pleasant office space in Berlin Kreuzberg/Mitte with great coffee, offering the flexibility of a hybrid work environment.


In 2021, a group of art historians and developers recognized the potential of new technologies to ease the creation of digital catalogues raisonnés and archives for global audiences. NavigatingArt has since applied digital strategies to meet the needs of institutions, increasing the availability of historical materials and lowering the barrier to comprehensive research. It became a nonprofit organization in 2024, supported by the Hasso Plattner Foundation, thereby aligning its legal status with its mission to protect and promote cultural heritage.

Our values


Integrity: transparency, authenticity, and responsibility are at the fore of everything we do.

Expertise: we grow personally and professionally while learning from mistakes and striving for excellence.

Durability: we prioritize longevity in the products and materials we create in an effort to do things only once — even when this emphasis requires slow thinking and development.

Collaboration: we work across teams to overcome complex challenges that require everyone’s contribution, not just those at the top.


NavigatingArt is committed to providing a friendly and safe environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, religion (or lack thereof), and art preferences.
html: About the job
reason: Matches all criteria: English-speaking, Product Owner role, experience within range, no unwanted language requirements, aligns with desired roles, acceptable industry, location in Berlin, and no excessive travel.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager (Creator Community)
description:
About the job
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 15 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

We’re looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead the positioning, messaging, and lifecycle communication for our fast-growing travel creator community—one of the largest in the world.

In this role, you’ll treat the creator community as a product: identifying and deeply understanding our audience segments, driving top-of-the-funnel awareness and acquisition, and crafting personalised messaging and value propositions that drive conversion, engagement, and retention.

You’ll sit at the intersection of community, content, and product marketing, developing strategic campaigns that enhance the community offering for both potential and existing members.

Learn more about it here, here and here.

You Will

Community as Product: Strategy & Positioning

Define and own the value proposition and messaging for our creator community across audience segments (nano, micro, and mid-tier creators)
Craft and optimize the messaging across the user journey—from social follower to active community member
Develop a communication strategy that scales across geographies and tiers, focused on creator needs and behavior
Translate community insights and feedback into refined positioning, product features, and marketing content

Lifecycle Communication & Engagement

Design and execute a multi-channel engagement strategy (email, CRM, social, events) tailored to acquisition, onboarding, activation, and retention phases
Drive lifecycle campaigns to move creators through the funnel—improving conversion rates from follower → applicant → active member
Create campaigns that highlight the benefits, tools, and success stories within the community to reinforce value and foster advocacy
Manage the community Instagram and TikTok accounts, including editorial planning and creative production
Analyze and optimize campaign performance, using data to inform content and targeting decisions
Own and track KPIs including conversion rates, onboarding activation, engagement levels, and community retention.

Who You Are

4+ years of experience in product marketing, lifecycle marketing, or creator/influencer marketing
Proven track record of segmenting audiences to improve product adoption and conversion rates and optimizing value propositions 
Proven experience managing lifecycle marketing strategies and content across owned channels (CRM and social)
Strong analytical skills; comfortable owning KPIs and using data to optimize campaigns and messaging
Experience with tools like HubSpot, Braze, or similar CRM platforms
Exceptional communication and project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives
Experience working in the creator economy or on community-led products is a big plus

How We Set You Up For Success

Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal-opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams

We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Who You Are
  • 4+ years of experience in product marketing, lifecycle marketing, or creator/influencer marketing
  • Proven track record of segmenting audiences to improve product adoption and conversion rates and optimizing value propositions
  • Proven experience managing lifecycle marketing strategies and content across owned channels (CRM and social)
  • Strong analytical skills; comfortable owning KPIs and using data to optimize campaigns and messaging
  • Experience with tools like HubSpot, Braze, or similar CRM platforms
  • Exceptional communication and project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives
  • Experience working in the creator economy or on community-led products is a big plus

How We Set You Up For Success
  • Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
  • Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal-opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams

We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - AI
description:
About the job
About The Opportunity

Contentful is the leading content platform for digital-first businesses, enabling teams to unify content and deliver it at scale. We are seeking a Product Marketing Manager (f/m/d) to own the go-to-market strategy for our AI product group, starting with our AI Actions capability. In this role, you will be instrumental in shaping the product’s positioning, messaging, and adoption strategy. You will collaborate closely with Product, Sales, Marketing, GTM PMM, Pricing & Packaging, and Enablement teams to develop compelling strategies and materials that resonate with business audiences. You will report directly to the Director of Product Marketing.

This is a unique opportunity to drive the success of Contentful’s AI portfolio and showcase how our platform empowers enterprises worldwide to create intelligent, automated digital experiences at scale.

What To Expect

Product Positioning & Messaging: You will develop clear, compelling, and differentiated product positioning, messaging, and value propositions for AI capabilities, ensuring alignment with Contentful’s overall brand narrative. You will focus on translating technical concepts and AI capabilities into business-oriented value propositions that resonate with content, marketing, and digital teams.
Market & Competitive Analysis: To support the growth of our AI offering, you will conduct ongoing market and competitive research. Staying ahead of AI trends, emerging technologies, and competitive solutions, you will synthesize insights into actionable recommendations that influence product strategies and roadmap decisions.
Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy & Execution: You will collaborate with Product Management and GTM PMM to craft and execute go-to-market plans for new AI features and enhancements. Partnering with cross-functional teams, you will develop launch materials, campaigns, and strategies designed to drive adoption, expansion, and customer success. You will also work closely with Pricing & Packaging teams to ensure go-to-market strategies are aligned with business goals.
Sales Enablement: You will partner with GTM PMM and Field Enablement teams to create impactful sales enablement tools such as pitch decks, competitive battle cards, business case materials, and product demos. Your goal will be to ensure Sales is equipped to confidently position and sell AI Actions based on tangible business value.
Storytelling & Thought Leadership: You will become a subject matter expert on AI technology, translating complex AI and technical capabilities into relatable, business-focused outcomes. You will create enablement content, demo scripts, and product tours that emphasize how AI supports operational efficiency, content strategy, and business growth. Through storytelling, you will help Contentful stand out as a leader in AI-driven content solutions.
Performance Measurement: You will track and analyze product marketing performance metrics such as adoption rates, campaign effectiveness, and sales enablement impact. Using these insights, you will optimize GTM strategies and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership for future initiatives.

What You Need To Be Successful

Experience: 5+ years in product marketing, with at least 2 years focused on SaaS products, AI solutions, or B2B SaaS platforms.
Technical Acumen: Comfortable explaining APIs, AI features, AI agents, automation features, and platform capabilities in business terms. Able to translate technical and emerging concepts into clear business value propositions.
Strategic Mindset: Ability to analyze market trends, identify opportunities, and influence product roadmaps aligned with company objectives.
Curiosity & Learning: Demonstrates a growth mindset, with a strong eagerness to research, understand, and explain complex and emerging AI technologies. Comfortable ramping up quickly on new topics.
Communication Skills: Excellent written, verbal, and presentation abilities. Skilled at crafting compelling narratives for business audiences.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven experience partnering with Product, Sales, Marketing, and Enablement teams to align strategies and drive results.
Analytical Approach: Strong data analysis and reporting skills, with the ability to turn insights into actionable GTM strategies.
Location: Berlin-based (or willing to relocate). This role will require occasional travel to conferences, events, and Contentful offices worldwide.

What's in it for you?

Join an ambitious tech company reshaping the way people build digital experiences
Full-time employees receive Stock Options for the opportunity to share in the success of our company
Fertility and family building benefits, including a lifetime reimbursable wallet to support your growing family.
We value Work-Life balance and You Time! A generous amount of paid time off, including vacation days, sick days, education days, compassion days for loss, and volunteer days
Use your personal annual education budget to improve your skills and grow in your career
Enjoy a full range of virtual and in-person events, including workshops, guest speakers, and fun team activities, supporting learning and networking exchange beyond the usual work duties 
An annual wellbeing stipend to care for your physical, financial, or emotional health
A monthly communication phone/internet stipend and phone hardware upgrade reimbursement.
New hire office equipment stipend for hybrid or distributed employees. Get the gear you need to work at your best.

Who are we?

Contentful is a leading digital experience platform that helps modern businesses meet the growing demand for engaging, personalized content at scale. By blending composability with native AI capabilities, Contentful enables dynamic personalization, automated content delivery, and real-time experimentation, powering next-generation digital experiences across brands, regions, and channels for more than 4,200 organizations worldwide. More than 700 people from more than 70 nations contribute their energy and creativity to Contentful, working from hubs in Berlin, Denver, San Francisco, London, New York, and distributed worldwide.

Everyone is welcome here!

“Everyone is welcome here” is a celebrated component of our culture. At Contentful, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed. We invite you to apply and join us!

If you need reasonable accommodations at any point during the application or interview process, please let your recruiting coordinator know.

Please be aware of scammers who may fraudulently allege to be from Contentful. These types of fraud can be carried out through copycat websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal information, such as bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc, through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment. If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reach out to us at security-esk@contentful.com with any information you may have.

By clicking “Apply for this job,” I acknowledge that I have read the “Contentful’s Candidate Privacy Notice” and hereby consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of my personal information as described therein.

  • New hire office equipment stipend for hybrid or distributed employees. Get the gear you need to work at your best.

title: Junior Influencer Marketing Manager  | French Speaking
description:
About the job
About Yepoda

At Yepoda, Korean effectiveness meets sustainable solutions: our mindfully produced skincare products are made with love in Korea. Our mission is to bring the best beauty innovations from Korea straight to Europe – without ever compromising on our values, quality and sustainability. All our products are made with the best natural and active ingredients, are vegan and cruelty-free. We aim to make the K-Beauty routine easy, effective, and fun.

We are a beauty start-up founded in 2020 and located in the heart of Berlin. Our team is comprised of over 80 brilliant human beings who came from all over the world to write Yepoda’s story actively.

We are currently looking for a Junior Influencer Marketing Manager to support our team in the field of Influencer Marketing within the French market. This role is ideal for someone with 1–2 years of relevant experience who is eager to deepen their expertise and grow their career in Influencer Marketing.

Your Tasks

Researching and identifying potential influencers for collaboration. 
Managing relationships with influencers, their agencies, and our brand. 
Help with the briefing process, ensuring influencers align with our expectations. 
Negotiate partnerships, focusing on performance and budget considerations. 
Contribute to the execution of our Influencer Marketing strategy to support revenue growth. 
Assist in analysing campaign performance, tracking relevant KPIs, and preparing reports. 
Take ownership of essential operational tasks to ensure smooth execution and operational excellence throughout the entire influencer collaboration process. 

Your Profile

You graduated from studies in Marketing, Economics, Business or a related field. 
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in Sales, Business Development, and/or Marketing. 
Excellent French and English language skills. 
Proven track record of achieving revenue KPI's/targets. 
You are focused on results, can think creatively, and have strong communication and negotiation skills. 
You are comfortable handling operational and repetitive tasks, bring a go-getter and hands-on attitude, and stay motivated even during routine processes. 
Passion for beauty, numbers & social media (Instagram, TikTok, Youtube). 
Good skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word etc.) and Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Sheets etc.). 

What We Offer

Dynamic Environment: The opportunity to work in a start-up environment surrounded by a passionate and dedicated team. 
Accelerate Your Career: Take on responsibility from day 1, with room for professional growth and advancement as the company continues to expand. 
Inspiring Workspace: Located in the heart of Berlin's Prenzlauer Berg, a dog-friendly office, with free drinks and snacks. 
Hybrid Working: We understand that sometimes you get more stuff done from home and need a change of scenery. 
We Value Diversity: We seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds. A welcoming, international, dedicated team with flat hierarchies and trust by default. 
Employee Discounts: You’ll get to enjoy the Yepoda products at a discount and share it with friends and family. 
Unique add-ons: Enjoy an Urban Sports membership package to help you stay active and healthy. 

Would you like to be part of the team? Then we'd love to hear from you! 🫰✨

Make sure to apply by clicking on the “Apply for this job” button below. Please upload your CV and Cover Letter in English language. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

At Yepoda we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Customer Success Manager
description:
About the job
Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced and passionate Senior Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic team. As the Senior Customer Success Manager, you will be a pivotal link between our company and our valued clients in the Automotive and Manufacturing sector, ensuring their success in deploying Aleph Alpha’s software by maximizing the value they receive from our solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with our clients, becoming a trusted advisor and advocate for their needs. 
Onboard new clients effectively, guiding them through the implementation process and ensuring a smooth transition to our solutions. 
Support customers during the solution deployment and activation process. Be the first contact to our customers for their project plans, execution steps and desired business value definition. 
Understand clients' business objectives and tailor our solutions to meet their specific needs, providing ongoing guidance and support. 
 Proactively drive customer retention through identification opportunities for clients to optimize and expand their use of our products and services. 
Serve as the primary point of contact for client inquiries, issues, and escalations, working closely with internal teams to address and resolve them in a timely manner. 
Develop and deliver regular reports and presentations to clients, showcasing the value and impact of our solutions on their business goals. 
Collaborate with the sales and product development teams to relay client feedback and contribute to the enhancement of our AI offerings. 

Your Profile

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Proven experience in a customer-facing role, preferably as a Senior Customer Success Manager or similar position within the tech industry. 
Experience in managing complex customer projects with large high-touch and tech-touch customers. 
Strong understanding of artificial intelligence and data engineering concepts and applications. 
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. 
Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment. 
Demonstrated track record of driving customer success and satisfaction. 
Fluency in English is required. German is beneficial. 

What You Can Expect From Us

Become part of an AI revolution!
30 days of paid vacation
Access to a variety of fitness & wellness offerings via Wellhub
Mental health support through nilo.health
JobRad® Bike Lease
Substantially subsidized company pension plan for your future security
Subsidized Germany-wide transportation ticket
Budget for additional technical equipment
Regular team events to stay connected
Flexible working hours for better work-life balance and hybrid working model
Virtual Stock Option Plan

title: (Senior) Product Marketing Manager  remote
description:
About the job
Job Description

We at sevdesk

As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your mission

This role sits at the heart of our marketing team — where growth and product come together. With strong positioning, smart launches, and data-backed campaigns, you’ll help us attract and convert more of the right customers, faster.

As part of the marketing organization, you’ll act as the strategic connector between product and go-to-market, ensuring every release and customer insight translates into measurable business impact.

Here's how you'll make an impact:

Develop and execute product marketing strategies: positioning, messaging, and persona-driven segmentation. 
Translate deep customer insights into compelling messaging through research, interviews, and behavioral analysis. 
Monitor the competitive landscape and market trends to sharpen strategic direction. 
Create and optimize conversion-driven content: landing pages, campaign assets, and in-product messaging. 
Own CRO and experimentation, running A/B tests to improve performance across the funnel. 
Leverage AI tools to scale research, content generation, and personalization with speed.

Your qualification

5+ years of product marketing experience in B2B SaaS, ideally in the SMB segment. 
You have broad digital marketing expertise + a strong track record of strategic thinking paired with hands-on execution — you know how to go from insight to impact. 
Proven ability to craft clear, benefit-driven messaging that translates complex features into tangible value. 
Experience with conversion rate optimization, experimentation, and funnel optimization. 
Comfort working in cross-functional teams, especially close collaboration with product. 
Curiosity and a proactive mindset when it comes to leveraging AI tools for research, creation and optimization. 
Fluency in German (native level) and strong English skills (C1+) to operate confidently across teams and markets. 
You live in Germany.

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you’re most productive, whether that’s at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, …), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

  • Curiosity and a proactive mindset when it comes to leveraging AI tools for research, creation and optimization.
  • Fluency in German (native level) and strong English skills (C1+) to operate confidently across teams and markets.
  • You live in Germany.

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you’re most productive, whether that’s at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, …), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

Kontaktperson: Saskia Schwartz
reason: Matches criteria: Product Marketing Manager role, English language requirement met, experience within acceptable range, aligns with desired roles, Berlin location, and acceptable benefits.

title: Junior CRM Marketing Manager - Remote
description:
About the job
About The Role

As a Junior CRM Specialist, you design campaign strategies with our customers, set up the technical requirements with your team and bring the campaigns live. You can help create the texts for push messages or e-mail newsletters and create all the graphic materials you need with the help of our design team. In addition to designing and creating campaigns, you interpret reports and perform A/B tests to optimize customer CRM campaigns. You contribute directly to the success of our customers by supporting their app users optimally along the customer journey with your campaigns. You support the big names in the industry such as Audible and Deutsche Telekom. At the same time, we enable you to build up cutting-edge expertise in the CRM field in no time at all.

Your Responsibilities

Conceptualization of campaigns
Creation & coordination of creative campaigns
Formulate texts of e-mails, push notifications & in-app messages
Automation of CRM campaigns
Evaluation of reports
Optimization of campaign performance
Supporting advice for the customer on CRM campaigns

Your Skills Are Needed

Basic Skills in the field of email marketing, CRM, or HTML5 development 
Affinity for mobile technologies
Interest in AI & automatisation technologies such as Chatgpt, Gemini, Midjourney, HeyGen, Make or N8n
Rapid understanding
Structured way of working
Independent organization & adherence to deadlines
Commitment & responsibility
Flexibility & passion, communication skills, and teamwork
Fluent in German and English, both written and spoken

Your Benefits

Join our team in Berlin and experience a workplace that values your individuality and provides exceptional benefits. Enjoy flexible working hours, and the option to work from our Berlin office, from home, or remotely from your country of residence. Furthermore, we offer corporate benefits, full coverage of your BVG Jobticket and for parents, childcare support for their non-school-age children.

We're committed to diversity and equal opportunity for all, welcoming individuals of any gender, age, origin, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. If you're creative, problem-solving, and passionate about app marketing, we'd love to hear from you. Join us and be yourself, in an atmosphere where diversity is celebrated and embraced.

title: Senior Manager 3PL
description:
About the job
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest-growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands. Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

The Senior Manager 3PL is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of third-party logistics operations to ensure they meet Autodoc’s (ATD) performance, operational expectations, and business requirements. This role requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders to define logistics needs, ensuring that 3PL partners execute on end-to-end operations efficiently, including inbound logistics, inventory management, fulfillment, transport, claims, and returns. The Senior Manager 3PL will act as the primary interface between ATD and its 3PL partners, driving continuous improvement, operational excellence, and alignment with business goals.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain overall logistics strategy involving multiple stakeholders across the business
Select, negotiate, and contract with qualified 3PL partners
Ensure that the warehouse 3PL meets the AUTODOC Performance and Operational expectations
Ensure best practice implementation on end-to-end operations - inbounding, inventory management, fulfillment, transport, claims, and returns
Act as the main interface with AUTODOC stakeholders, e.g. Revenue Management, Private Brand, Controlling, and SCM peers, assessing their requirements towards the 3PL.
Ensure that customer orders are appropriately prioritized and fulfilled on time and in full on a daily basis
Identify improvement activities and monitor their implementation
Conduct weekly / monthly business reviews related to cost and operational performance. 
Work with Supply Chain and Category Management teams to re-adjust operating model whenever needed and constantly adapt the inventory profile
Act as the interface between AUTODOC and the 3PL, also representing the interests of 3PL towards our stakeholders
Drive strategic reviews and analysis with 3PL to understand capacity & financial opportunities and risks
Prepare and manage price and contract negotiations
Define and own standards and rules for (internal) QA at 3PL locations
Partner with our Customer Experience team to understand current and future customer demand and proactively develop own concepts to improve our value proposition.


Qualifications

At least 7 years in supply chain and management of Third Party Logistic Services
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Logistics, Technology, Operations, or similar
Experience in selecting and performance managing 3rd party logistics providers
Experience and proven track record in logistics cost optimization initiatives
Strong management experience, analytical skills, process management, TPM, Lean or Six Sigma experiences preferred
Experience managing remote teams
Business fluency in English, any additional language is beneficial 


What do we offer?

Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast-growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further training (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform), and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

title: Senior Account Manager - Growth Team
description:
About the job
About Agicap

Since our foundation in Lyon in 2016, we have been revolutionizing the liquidity planning market for SMEs across Europe. We enable our clients to strategically manage their cash flow - to stay on top of things, to look ahead and to grow. Being part of Agicap means enabling every business to grow and helping companies achieve their entrepreneurial goals.

Through one of the largest FinTech funding rounds of USD 100 million, we have grown from 3 founders to >500 employees. Our office in Berlin was launched in 2020 and continuously expanded to a team of :90 Agicapians now. But we are just getting started and are looking for team players with an entrepreneurial mindset and the will to make Agicap the No. 1 all-in-one tool for cash flow in Europe.

About The Role

Your mission at Agicap is to further develop our sales capabilities in the Account Management Growth team, focusing on the expansion of our largest accounts. Beyond sales, we seek individuals who can collaborate with the Product team to unlock new sales opportunities and drive product adoption.

Our Account Management Teams are pivotal to Agicap's growth and retention strategies. As a Senior Key Account Manager, you take full Commercial ownership in managing and expanding our largest customer accounts, driving revenue growth, and enhancing customer satisfaction. This role is essential in our ambition to extend our position as SaaS leader in Treasury Management from SMB to mid-market customers.

The Mission:

What you will do:

 Manage a portfolio of 150-250 customers, focusing on our largest accounts-Own commercial activities on your portfolio, including renewals and upselling, supported by an Activation Specialist for ongoing product adoption
 Develop and implement strategies to achieve 95%+ Net Revenue Retention (NRR) and 20%+ yearly upsells on your portfolio
 Collaborate closely with the Product team to push solutions that unblock new sales opportunities
 Act as an operational role model for the rest of the team, demonstrating strong SaaS business acumen and financial understanding
 Drive the transition to a Salesforce model, ensuring full ownership of commercial activities while leveraging support from Activation Specialists
 Advocate for our customers within the organization, ensuring their needs are met and exceeded


What you need to succeed:

 5+ years of professional experience, with at least 1 year in roles with closing responsibility (e.g., Account Executive, Key Account Manager)
 Proven track record of consistently reaching or outperforming targets
 Strong knowledge of software sales, renewal management, and financial acumen
 Experience with Gainsight and Hubspot is a plus
 Prior experience in FinTech/SaaS is advantageous
 Fluency in German at a C2 level and business-fluent English skills
 A proactive nature and a continuous drive for improvement
 The ability to excel in a dynamic growth environment, quickly adapt to challenges, and maintain a positive attitude
 Excellent listening skills, customer-centric mentality, and empathy towards users and customers
 Ability to work with diverse teams (Sales, CS, Tech, Product, etc.)


What is in it for you:

 Competitive compensation package with uncapped commission
 “Mini-MBA” with a focus on Finance & Treasury through the Agicap Academy
 Opportunity to work for a globally diverse team with occasional trips to the headquarters in France
 >€100 Monthly Lunch Budget
 Large Office at Moritzplatz with snacks, drinks and a large terrace


Join Agicap and be part of a team that is shaping the future of financial management solutions. Apply now to become a Senior Key Account Manager and drive our success!
